00:00:04:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:04:220000.Dialogue: Oh, I always tear up when the Grinch's heart grows three sizes.

00:00:08:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:08:160000.Dialogue: Tears seem appropriate. Enlargement of the heart muscle, or hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, is a serious disease which could lead to congestive heart failure.

00:00:21:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:21:010000.Dialogue: You really didn't like it, Sheldon?

00:00:23:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:23:080000.Dialogue: No, on the contrary. I found the Grinch to be a relatable, engaging character. And I was really with him right up to the point that he succumbed to social convention and returned the presents and saved Christmas. What a buzz kill that was.

00:00:40:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:40:200000.Dialogue: When we watch Frosty the Snowman, he roots for the sun.

00:00:43:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:43:170000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but the sun is essential for all life on Earth. Frosty is merely a bit of frozen supernatural ephemera in a stolen hat. A crime, by the way, for which he is never brought to account.

00:01:29:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:29:110000.Dialogue: I just love decorating the Christmas tree. HELP YOU FIND THE PERFECT GIFT It makes me feel like a little girl again.

00:01:34:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:34:150000.Dialogue: We didn't have a tree when I was growing up.

00:01:38:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:38:110000.Dialogue: Mmm, in my family, holidays weren't so much celebrated as studied for their anthropological and psychological implications on human society.

00:01:46:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:46:110000.Dialogue: Oh, sounds festive. Did you at least give presents?

00:01:50:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:50:020000.Dialogue: Mmm, in a way. We presented papers.

00:01:55:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:55:100000.Dialogue: And then broke off into focus groups and critiqued each other.

00:01:59:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:59:170000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what about you? Did you have a Christmas tree?

00:02:02:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:02:070000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. We had a tree, we had a manger, we had an inflatable Santa Claus with plastic reindeer on the front lawn.

00:02:11:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:11:040000.Dialogue: And to make things even more jolly, there were so many blinking lights on the house they induced neighborhood-wide seizures.

00:02:17:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:17:180000.Dialogue: So I take it you don't want to help us trim the tree.

00:02:20:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:20:160000.Dialogue: I do not. But if you insist on decorating a spider-infested fire hazard in my home I would request that you add this.

00:02:30:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:30:160000.Dialogue: You're kidding, right? It's a bust of Sir Isaac Newton.

00:02:39:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:39:200000.Dialogue: Wait, excuse me, but it's much more "Christmasy" than anything you've put on the tree.

00:02:45:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:45:080000.Dialogue: December 25, 1642, Julian calendar, Sir Isaac Newton is born. Jesus, on the other hand, was actually born in the summer-- His birthday was moved to coincide with a traditional pagan holiday that celebrated the winter solstice with lit fires and slaughtered goats.

00:03:01:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:01:010000.Dialogue: Which, frankly, sounds like more fun than 12 hours of church with my mother followed by a fruitcake.

00:03:10:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:10:070000.Dialogue: I sense that's not sincere, although I have no idea why.

00:03:14:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:14:110000.Dialogue: No, it's fine. Look, Sir Issac can go right next to this little candy cane.

00:03:17:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:17:120000.Dialogue: No. Isaac goes at the top of the tree.

00:03:22:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:22:030000.Dialogue: I understand. You dispute Newton's claim that he invented calculus and you want to put Gottfried Leibniz on the top.

00:03:29:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:29:070000.Dialogue: Yeah, you got me. I'm a Leibniz man.

00:03:31:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:31:210000.Dialogue: Well, perhaps when your mother gets here, she'll talk some sense into you.

00:03:39:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:39:010000.Dialogue: When were you going to tell me?

00:03:42:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:42:230000.Dialogue: Why were you keeping this a secret?

00:03:46:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:46:190000.Dialogue: If I can interject here, obviously Leonard is concerned that his mother won't approve of you as his mate.

00:03:52:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:52:200000.Dialogue: Why wouldn't she approve of me? I'm adorable.

00:03:59:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:59:040000.Dialogue: If I can interject again. Leonard comes from a remarkably high-achieving family, who have all chosen high-achieving partners. He probably feels that it's doubtful that his mother will be overly impressed with his dating a woman whose most significant achievement is memorizing the Cheesecake Factory menu.

00:04:21:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:21:030000.Dialogue: There's two pages just for desserts.

00:04:22:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:22:220000.Dialogue: I know. And those specials-- they change every day.

00:04:26:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:26:080000.Dialogue: Okay, you know what? It's lame when I say it. It's just ridiculous when you pile on.

00:04:32:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:32:050000.Dialogue: So what did she say when you told her we were going out? You didn't tell her we were going out, did you? Why not?

00:04:42:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:42:100000.Dialogue: Leonard... I'm no expert on meditation, but if you're trying to calm yourself down, I believe the word is "Om."

00:04:53:040000.Speaker: Beverley
00:04:53:040000.Dialogue: It was so nice of you to come all the way down to the airport to pick me up.

00:05:05:170000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:05:170000.Dialogue: I've been meaning to thank you for your notes on my paper disproving quantum brain dynamic theory.

00:05:10:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:10:090000.Dialogue: My pleasure. For a non-physicist, you have a remarkable grasp of how electric dipoles in the brain's water molecules could not possibly form a Bose condensate.

00:05:20:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:20:070000.Dialogue: Wait, wait, wait. When did you send my mom notes on a paper?

00:05:24:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:24:150000.Dialogue: August 16. Right after her carpal tunnel surgery.

00:05:30:020000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:30:020000.Dialogue: Oh, did I thank you for the flowers?

00:05:33:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:33:110000.Dialogue: Neither do I, but it's the social convention.

00:05:37:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:37:140000.Dialogue: Wait, wait, wait. You had surgery?

00:05:39:140000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:39:140000.Dialogue: Yes, and Sheldon sent me flowers.

00:05:42:180000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:42:180000.Dialogue: Then what was all that "wait, wait, wait" about?

00:05:45:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:45:100000.Dialogue: I just don't understand why he knows more about your life than I do.

00:05:49:230000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:49:230000.Dialogue: Well, I would assume it's because Sheldon and I stay in touch due to mutual interest and respect, while you avoid me, due to unresolved childhood issues.

00:06:02:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:02:190000.Dialogue: We discussed it at length during our last video chat. Although how we got onto the subject of you is baffling.

00:06:08:230000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:08:230000.Dialogue: Yes, but we are on the subject, so I'm obliged to ask.

00:06:22:190000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:22:190000.Dialogue: Have you heard your brother has gotten engaged?

00:06:24:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:24:170000.Dialogue: No. Sheldon, why didn't you tell me?

00:06:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:28:050000.Dialogue: My bad. I did send a gift from both of us.

00:06:32:160000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:32:160000.Dialogue: She's a remarkable girl. The youngest appeals court judge in New Jersey and a two-time Olympic bronze medalist.

00:06:44:060000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:44:060000.Dialogue: So, how about you? Are you seeing anyone interesting?

00:06:47:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:47:080000.Dialogue: Well, I'm not sure about interesting, but...

00:06:51:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:51:070000.Dialogue: Very well. Shall we switch topics to Isaac Newton v. Gottfried Leibniz?

00:06:57:060000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:57:060000.Dialogue: It's all right, Sheldon. I will just pretend that Leonard's not withholding information. Although, I will point out, Leonard, that I am a trained psychiatrist and you are exhibiting the same secretive behavioral tics that accompanied your learning to masturbate.

00:07:14:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:14:220000.Dialogue: Isn't she brilliant, Leonard? How I envy you.

00:07:21:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:07:21:220000.Dialogue: So, Howard, have you and Rajesh finally summoned the courage to express your latent homosexual feelings toward one another?

00:07:38:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:38:090000.Dialogue: Because we don't have latent homosexual feelings toward one another.

00:07:43:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:43:190000.Dialogue: No, really. I have a girlfriend now.

00:07:47:110000.Speaker: Beverley
00:07:47:110000.Dialogue: And where is she this evening?

00:07:48:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:48:210000.Dialogue: She had to go out of town. Her grandmother died.

00:07:57:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:57:220000.Dialogue: Honest to God. Leonard, tell her I have a girlfriend.

00:08:01:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:01:200000.Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about.

00:08:03:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:03:220000.Dialogue: What do you mean you don't know what I'm talking about? Tell her I have a girlfriend!

00:08:13:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:13:180000.Dialogue: Her name is Bernadette. She's working as a waitress, but she's going to school to be a microbiologist.

00:08:18:030000.Speaker: Beverley
00:08:18:030000.Dialogue: Howard, keep in mind that the more passionately you stick to this construct, the more you're hurting your partner.

00:08:26:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:26:200000.Dialogue: Do you really think your lips in my ear is helping?

00:08:33:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:33:050000.Dialogue: Oh, glad you're here. Uh, sit down. I'll get you a plate. Mom, you remember Penny.

00:08:37:000000.Speaker: Beverley
00:08:37:000000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, the waitress slash actress with the unresolved father issues. Has he finally come to terms with his little slugger growing breasts?

00:08:46:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:46:090000.Dialogue: Well, he sent me a football and a catcher's mitt for Christmas, so I'm going to say no.

00:08:51:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:51:170000.Dialogue: If it helps, we're all good with your breasts.

00:09:01:030000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:01:030000.Dialogue: Oh, speaking of fathers, Leonard, that reminds me, I'm divorcing your father.

00:09:07:020000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:07:020000.Dialogue: Yes. He was cheating on me.

00:09:08:110000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:08:110000.Dialogue: Yes, with some waitress from the university cafeteria. Can you believe it? A waitress? Oh, no offense, dear.

00:09:18:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:18:090000.Dialogue: No, it sounded like a compliment.

00:09:23:100000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:23:100000.Dialogue: Mmm, well, let's see. Sheldon, when did I leave Leonard's father?

00:09:28:170000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:28:170000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, that's right. The weekend after Leonard's dog died.

00:09:34:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:34:200000.Dialogue: She was old and blind, Leonard. What choice did we have?

00:09:39:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:39:160000.Dialogue: I don't believe this. Why am I the last to know?!

00:09:42:110000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:42:110000.Dialogue: Excuse me, Leonard, I am the one who's getting a divorce, Mitzy is the one who is dead. Why are you the one making a fuss?

00:09:48:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:48:060000.Dialogue: You're right. I'm-I'm-I'm-I'm sorry. I'm way out of line!

00:09:55:080000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:55:080000.Dialogue: So, Penny, what's new in your life?

00:10:07:130000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:07:130000.Dialogue: Thank you for driving me back to my hotel.

00:10:11:200000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:11:200000.Dialogue: I was going to ask Leonard to do it, but he seemed a bit emotionally unstable and you don't want someone like that operating heavy machinery.

00:10:23:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:23:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, I gotta put a sticker over that. So, uh, you must be devastated about your divorce.

00:10:33:120000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:33:120000.Dialogue: Oh, not at all. But I am a bit distressed to be in a vehicle that's not subjected to regular maintenance.

00:10:40:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:40:170000.Dialogue: Come on, I mean, you're not upset that your marriage is over?

00:10:44:090000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:44:090000.Dialogue: Well, initially I felt something akin to grief and perhaps anger, but that's the natural reaction of the limbic system to being betrayed by a loathsome son of a bitch.

00:10:57:010000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:57:010000.Dialogue: Thankfully, my shock was somewhat mitigated by the fact that I haven't had intercourse with him in eight years.

00:11:03:150000.Speaker: Beverley
00:11:03:150000.Dialogue: Oh, that's nothing. I've been responsible for my own orgasms since 1982.

00:11:17:030000.Speaker: Beverley
00:11:17:030000.Dialogue: That's exactly what I say during orgasms: "Yikes."

00:11:21:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:21:220000.Dialogue: You know what? I could use a drink. Do you want to stop for a drink?

00:11:41:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:41:050000.Dialogue: I didn't make tea for you.

00:11:48:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:48:000000.Dialogue: Then why are you telling me?

00:11:56:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:56:050000.Dialogue: Oh, is it? We're conversing. Checkmate.

00:12:01:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:01:200000.Dialogue: What I want is to be departing the starship Enterprise in a one-man shuttle craft headed to the planetoid I rule known as Sheldon Alpha Five.

00:12:15:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:15:010000.Dialogue: To comfort you, of course. No, that's not going to work at all. I'll comfort you from over here.

00:12:27:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:27:010000.Dialogue: Leonard, what you're experiencing is a classic Jungian crisis in which the aging individual mourns the loss of the never-to-be realized ideal family unit.

00:12:45:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:45:050000.Dialogue: No, no. The comforting part is that the Germans have a term for what you're feeling. Weltschmerz. It means the depression that arises from comparing the world as it is to a hypothetical, idealized world.

00:13:00:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:00:230000.Dialogue: You're right, I do feel better.

00:13:03:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:03:150000.Dialogue: Well, the Germans have always been a comforting people.

00:13:09:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:09:230000.Dialogue: Just remember, Leonard, where your biological family has failed you, you always have me, your surrogate family.

00:13:21:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:21:210000.Dialogue: If it's any consolation, I'm not happy about it either. Good night.

00:13:29:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:29:070000.Dialogue: Okay, now this time try drinking it all at once.

00:13:46:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:46:170000.Dialogue: I've been responsible for my own buzz since 2003.

00:13:51:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:51:190000.Dialogue: Another round for me and my homegirl.

00:13:55:210000.Speaker: Beverley
00:13:55:210000.Dialogue: I feel a spreading warmth through my extremities.

00:14:00:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:00:150000.Dialogue: As long as you don't feel it running down your pants, you're fine.

00:14:11:190000.Speaker: Beverley
00:14:11:190000.Dialogue: Oh, that is fascinating. I'm noticing an immediate lowering of my inhibitions. For example, I'm seriously considering asking that busboy to ravish me in the alleyway while I eat cheesecake.

00:14:31:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:31:140000.Dialogue: Well, we are known for our cheesecake.

00:14:53:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:53:040000.Dialogue: The one from whom I live across the hall... from.

00:14:57:150000.Speaker: Beverley
00:14:57:150000.Dialogue: Well, that's convenient. How did his penis turn out?

00:15:01:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:01:180000.Dialogue: Oh, Beverly, I can't talk to my boyfriend's mother about his penis.

00:15:06:100000.Speaker: Beverley
00:15:06:100000.Dialogue: Oh, fair enough. What can you tell me, if anything, about that busboy's penis?

00:15:16:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:16:070000.Dialogue: actually, I've only had the cheesecake. One more time. You know, Leonard did not want to tell you we were dating.

00:15:25:150000.Speaker: Beverley
00:15:25:150000.Dialogue: Really? Well, that means he's either embarrassed about the relationship or he doesn't care enough about his mother to tell her he's in one. Either way, one of us should be insulted.

00:15:37:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:37:200000.Dialogue: Well, let's go find out who.

00:15:40:180000.Speaker: Beverley
00:15:40:180000.Dialogue: You go get a taxi. I'm gonna slip my business card into that busboy's back pocket, cupping his firm, right buttock as I do so.

00:15:58:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:58:050000.Dialogue: Get out here! Your mommy wants to talk to you!

00:16:02:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:02:190000.Dialogue: What the hell is going on?

00:16:08:180000.Speaker: Beverley
00:16:08:180000.Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me you were tapping my homegirl?

00:16:23:190000.Speaker: Beverley
00:16:23:190000.Dialogue: Well, I hope so. Otherwise, why would we have stopped at Del Taco?

00:16:29:120000.Speaker: Beverley
00:16:29:120000.Dialogue: Now, how could you not tell me you were in a relationship with this lovely, charming young woman?

00:16:35:070000.Speaker: Beverley
00:16:35:070000.Dialogue: You're welcome. Is it because she's uneducated, trapped in a menial service position?

00:16:42:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:42:160000.Dialogue: What the hell happened to "lovely and charming"?

00:16:45:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:45:230000.Dialogue: How come you didn't tell me that you and Father were getting a divorce? How come you didn't tell me you had surgery? How come you didn't tell me my dog died?

00:16:56:010000.Speaker: Beverley
00:16:56:010000.Dialogue: What I hear you saying is that you want a more intimate mother-son relationship.

00:17:14:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:17:14:220000.Dialogue: There. It's late. Now, go to bed.

00:17:29:160000.Speaker: Beverley
00:17:29:160000.Dialogue: I'm getting a warm feeling spreading through my heart.

00:17:42:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:42:210000.Dialogue: Why is Leonard softly banging his head against his bedroom door?

00:17:47:060000.Speaker: Beverley
00:17:47:060000.Dialogue: Speaking of warm feelings-- come here.

00:18:01:070000.Speaker: Beverley
00:18:01:070000.Dialogue: No, I'd rather have the busboy.

00:18:12:100000.Speaker: Beverley
00:18:12:100000.Dialogue: Thank you for taking me to the airport.

00:18:16:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:16:120000.Dialogue: Once again, I'm driving. I'm right here.

00:18:20:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:18:20:220000.Dialogue: Please, I am very hungover and in no mood to satisfy your need for approval.

00:18:28:040000.Speaker: Beverley
00:18:28:040000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I do hope you'll forgive me for my inappropriate behavior last night.

00:18:32:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:32:080000.Dialogue: I don't blame you. You were intoxicated.

00:18:37:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:37:160000.Dialogue: I blame Penny, too. Bad Penny.

00:18:42:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:42:160000.Dialogue: Wait a minute, what are you talking about? What inappropriate behavior?

00:18:46:100000.Speaker: Beverley
00:18:46:100000.Dialogue: I think it's best that you not know.

00:18:55:030000.Speaker: Beverley
00:18:55:030000.Dialogue: And I want you to take very good care of this young woman.

00:19:01:010000.Speaker: Beverley
00:19:01:010000.Dialogue: You're welcome. She doesn't have much in the way of career prospects. Don't make her responsible for her own orgasms as well.

00:19:12:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:12:050000.Dialogue: Mother, remember when I was complaining that you don't communicate with me enough?
